Reviews.Title: “Location and the people”
Reviews.Author: c51man
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, nice and the location is good for the downtown dallas area. The front desk was professional and took the time to help. we stayed 3 days March 29-31. The even helped correct a heat problem in the room because it was broken with the air very quickly. the wi-fi was easy to connect to.

Reviews.Title: “So Close”
Reviews.Author: Sula300
Reviews.Content: This used to be a Wilson World Hotel when I had stayed there some years ago. The service is top notch! But the rooms needs some updating. The breakfast is good but the overall daily menu is limited.

Reviews.Title: “Good, convenient overnight spot in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: vinman47
Reviews.Content: Nice location, clean, good breakfast and overall good selection for an overnight in the Dallas area. Plus they have a van that runs to 9PM that will take you downtown for dinner, etc. Thought this was a real plus as traffic is very busy in and around Dallas. Last thing--Amanda at the front desk was outstanding in helping us with several requests. Thanks Amanda.

Reviews.Title: “cheer somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: kaigeee
Reviews.Content: as part of a cheer competition, we were required to stay at this hotel. let me first state that, unfortunately, i am a hilton honors "silver" member. as such, there were no special privileges given to Hilton Honor members (except gold and platinum) at this hotel such as free wi-fi or parking, as is the norm at other hiltons. Also, there is a fee to enter the pools. This hotel is not convenient to many areas of Dallas of a tourist nature without transport, and is not convenient to the DART (train system). When you get a coffee at starbucks, if you stay a refill is an option for a small fee. This hotel did not have that courtesy. the shower really could have used a cleaning. Good points were the front desk staff, and the restaurants. Excellent service, and food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff... except housekeeping department”
Reviews.Author: srbot
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, a great restaurant, and unlike some of the other reviewers, we experienced the most helpful staff you could ever imagine. However the hotel room itself was extremely dirty. I would never stay here again. When I spend $150/night I do not expect a dirty hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amazing Amazing”
Reviews.Author: khalid N
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome time. From check in to check out was fantastic. Breakfast was even better simple because the waiter so attentive!!! Great place and will def. stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Years”
Reviews.Author: d4whatver82
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn New Years Eve to avoid the po po. It was great a stay. It was a little steep for the accomodations, but considering when we went I'm not really all that shocked. I just wish I'd thought to book earlier,and possibly avoided staying here. Like I said, nothing specific but I normally stay at Hilton, and so Hilton Garden Inn definitely felt like a budget hotel. They do have a shuttle to take you downtown though, so that is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: scrawnyronnie
Reviews.Content: Passing through on business. great staff, food, rooms - very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COST, OR YOU WILL LOSE YOUR PERSONAL PROPERTY!”
Reviews.Author: DeQuita
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night and we will NEVER make this mistake again! We booked 2 rooms, one room was supposed to have been a suite which was not. We were told that this hotel did not offer suites even though we were told that's what we were getting when we booked the rooms. Our vehicle had the back glass knocked out of it, the 2 back seats were stolen along with other expensive items we had in the back of our vehicle. I promptly reported this to the front desk and asked about the security cameras. The front desk attendant assured me that the camera tapes could be pulled but loe and behold, they have no security cameras as stated by the manager. I then was told that they have a night watchman the performs roving patrols of the grounds. Our vehicle could have been plainly seen from the front desk. The manager asked me if I would like for them to call the police, I said yes if thats not too much to ask for. The Dallas police were prompt and performed their job as they should have. No mention was ever made from this hotel management at the onset of our dilemma to ease our burden. After 2 hours into this ordeal, my wife ordered pizza for our children, due to getting late in the day. We had asked if the hotel shuttle service could take my wife and children to a restaurant which was about 3 blocks away, however we were told it would be an hour or so before they could take us. The pizza delivery person told her that the back fence was put up to help curb the theft problem that this hotel has and has not slowed down theft at this hotel one bit. He also stated that the other hotels in the area do not have the problems this hotel has. Almost seems as if this hotel's staff is fronting organized crime. I personally walked the grounds and found one secirity camera but all this camera would be able to see is the outside pool area. My wife has been in contact with the hilton corporate office concerning the happenings and the way we were purely dismissed. I only hope that one day when something as this happens to the management of this chain, they remember how they treat the patrons of their chain. I'm sure they sleep well at night knowing they have a steady income from outside sources. Just my personal thoughts. We will never stay here again, nor will we visit any hotel in this chain. There are several other chain type hotels owned by Hilton, and if they are anything like this I would avoid at all cost! Our safety was not protected, nor was our property. The general manager of this particular hotel went out of his way to avoid us, he wouldn't even make eye contact when addressed by my husband and I! I would think they would have immediately contacted this so called night "security officer" to find out exactly what he was doing while our vehicle was broken into. The worst part is, whomever broke out the back window had to pull right up beside us to load the back seats and contents of our vehicle! You could see where they had pulled the seats in order to load them.....didn't it raise a red flag when the security officer or front desk person saw a vehicle pull into the parking lot directly in front of the hotel and leave their car running while they broke out the back window and crawled through to steal our back seats and other things....this wasn't something that could have been accomlished quickly. The estimated time it took was well over 15 minutes!!!! I'm sorry, but somebody noticed something that worked at this hotel!!!! PS I have already been in contact with my corporate office and am working on ensuring our corporate travel does not include any stays at this chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: LiquidSunshine-NYC
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, a (small but stocked) bar, good breakfast, close to restaurants both downtown and uptown, and a PHENOMENAL staff. They are helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable about the area. You can walk across the street to the Renaissance Hotel if you want to enjoy a true bar/lounge experience and get in some people watching. Whether you're in town for business or pleasure, you can't go wrong with this Hilton Garden Inn. And did I mention the PRICE?? More than worth the money...

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Service”
Reviews.Author: Rev A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here about three weeks ago and were pleasantly surprised by the excellence of service and the quality of the room and the food. We only stayed one night but it definitely won't be our last night of stay there. The Management team there is some of the best I have ever seen, very customer responsive. We highly recommend this hotel. The quality, service and price of this hotel makes it a compelling choice. The food there is on par with Five Star Hotels minus the cost. Arthur TX

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service? Check. Good location? Check. Great rooms? Check, check.”
Reviews.Author: Jessika J
Reviews.Content: When it comes to spending money on a good hotel, my dollar was not wasted one bit at this property. The hotel is conveniently located and staff is absolutely wonderful and work their hardest to cater to your needs. Customer service is definitely a main focal point of theirs. The rooms are spacious, have big screen TV's, and the beds are beyond comfortable! I literally fell asleep as soon as my head hit the pillow. Would definitely recommend to anyone and everyone. I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: Seedlet
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here with my boyfriend, which is quite a long time. All the staff were super nice and helpful. Room was neat and clean and huge! I spent 90% of my time in Dallas inside the room so I got to know it well. Nice big TV, great view. I slept like a rock at night which is pretty weird, I usually don't sleep well outside of my own room. Bed was big and comfy and warm. Never heard anyone else except for occasionally in the halls, but that was just people chatting as they went by. If I had to pick a complaint it's a bit weird getting in and out of the parking lot, apparently Dallas is the one-way-street capital of the world so if you get easily confused when driving I'd probably avoid the whole city all together! Hahaha, anyway, we would totally stay here again if we had to come back to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Market Center!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkie87
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and the staff is beyond compare. From front desk, sales, banquets and restaurant staff the emloyees are customer service focused. Immaculate rooms with awesome adjustable mattress makes sleep a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was great, but nothing is nearby but the medical centers”
Reviews.Author: newmexes
Reviews.Content: The breakfast, which was included in our rate, was fabulous. The omlette chef was great and kept the bacon, sausage, and other hot items stocked well. The hotel is only near the medical centers which was fine for us becuase we were taking a campus visit to UT Southwestern. But you can't walk to anything and fast food or dining options are all far away. The front desk staff seemed a little uppity compared to other places we stayed on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on you Hilton”
Reviews.Author: rohmdesign
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK, older hotel, very quiet, but need renovations. Can't believe any hotel, let alone a Hilton would allow the lumpiest comforters I have ever seen. Initial of the room was bad. Manager tried to tell me how comfortable the bed was because you can dial the hardness or softness of the bed with the dial on the side of the mattress. Hope Hilton didn't pay extra for these mattresses - it was a joke!

Reviews.Title: “One word. . . Horrible”
Reviews.Author: ClarkeInc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends, we were so excited about being in Dallas due to the Mavericks winning the championship! That was until we checked into this Hilton Garden, I have seen some better Garden Inn's and held expecatations for them all the same, but this by far was the worst. The gym was cool, the pool area was kept dirty, the front desk staff acted as if you owed them something and the rooms are OUT OF DATE! I will be staying at another hotel next time, even if I have to pay $100 more.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: George66052
Reviews.Content: Plus: nice size rooms, free internet access, bedding was comfortable. Workout room was functional but they offer an in-room workout kit which I ordered but was mostly useless and missing pieces. Breakfast was OK but not included in our rate. One day I discovered that my razor was missing from my bathroom. When I brought it up to the front desk, they just offered me one of those throwaway razors. Mine was only a $12 razor but still.... The only way I would stay here is if you had business at the DMC which is across the highway. I have stayed in Hilton Garden Inns at other locations that were much better.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel would not be my first choice in the area..”
Reviews.Author: cjc1977
Reviews.Content: I felt like the staff could have been more friendly..The rooms seemed fair..The breakfast was good..

Reviews.Title: “courteous and helpful staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: apshorsegirl
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the comfortable rooms, each one equipped with a microwave and a fridge. The beds were comfortable and the atmosphere lively and pleasant. There's also a free business center that's full of whatever you might need computer and communication wise. The best though was the service. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful with whatever I needed. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Above average Hilton Garden Inn”
Reviews.Author: AustinBeach001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn while driving back from Arkansas. The hotel is directly on IH-35 right next to the Hilton Anatole hotel (also really nice, but expensive) and across from the Dallas Market Center. We stayed in a 2 Double Deluxe room on Hilton HHonors points and the room was clean, comfortable, spacious, and very quiet. The hotel has a big lobby with glass elevators that look upon the 8-floor atrium at the lobby and the restaurant. The restaurant had good food in the evening but a Jury was staying at the hotel and it took a little while for the food to come out, in the morning, we ate breakfast at the hotel and the buffet was good and the waiters/waitresses are attentive and courteous. I have to recommend Alex at the restaurant and Jorge at the front desk. They were very nice and truly cared about the guests well being. We would stay here again, and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: HUTraveler02
Reviews.Content: I got a really great deal on this hotel on Priceline, but I guess you get what you pay for. Where should I begin...I came in to find 2 two double beds with lumpy comforters. It appears that the comforters have been used so much the stuffing has started bunching together so you have lumps of cotton gathered in the comforters. I then found a piece of dried rice on the pillow used as an accessory and stained pillowcases. I really try not to be critical, but then I went into the bathroom and found a moldy tub and a shower faucet that was falling apart. Do not think this hotel should be classified as a three star, as the accommodations are more in line with a two star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: iluv2goaway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Feb. All we needed was a clean hotel next to the main interchange as we were still traveling the next morning. We booked this one and were NOT let down. It was so quiet, the beds were adjustable and the room was clean. The Bathrooms could use some updating, but that did not affect the quality of our stay. Check-in was instant and check out was a breeze by pushing a button on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible room & hotel for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Westlake89
Reviews.Content: I had a trade show at the Anatole, and this hotel is literally three blocks away. I got a great price and was scared that it was another 'too good to be true" - but when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised. The front desk staff were very nice, and the rooms were very clean. I also appreciated the free Internet and the bed was extremely comfortable. This hotel is a few blocks from the highway so it's convenient to get in and out of - but it's far enough you can't hear the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Well worn HGI”
Reviews.Author: 53x11
Reviews.Content: a relatively large HGI situated nearby downtown dallas. typical HGI structure, look, and feel. interiors are well worn and could use some freshening up (dim lighting, old grout in bathrooms, dark carpets). tricky freeway exit and frontage road turnaround to access the hotel. otherwise clean and safe parking.

Reviews.Title: “No the best and not the worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hullnotdull
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, the first room we were offered was a smoking room and we don't smoke so the staff changed it for us. The nights sleep was interupted by a Biker's convention that were staying at the hotel and riding round and round the car park all night. The hotel was within easy reach of Dallas city centre and the shuttle bus was useful for this. To describe this hotel it was just OK

Reviews.Title: “Good location at very good price”
Reviews.Author: Knights82
Reviews.Content: End up at this hotel via Priceline and was happy with the place. Convenient location to downtown Dallas, spacious rooms, friendly staff and free Wi-Fi that worked well. Rooms include both a microwave oven and refrigreator. Restaurant on site, but I didn't try it (they charge $10.95 for breakfast). Only negatives (minor) are poor driveway access and noise. Rooms in front of hotel face freeway while those on the back side (where I stayed) can hear the rooftop A/C units. Overall, I was happy with the place and will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You call this customer service?”
Reviews.Author: wowk41
Reviews.Content: Manger at desk was very rude at check in, don't think he was happy to be there. When arriving to my room it was very smokey but was a NON-SMOKING room, was offered another room which turned out to smell a lot better, but the man at the desk was rude yet again and made me feel i was an inconvenience to him. Would not recommend or return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss, some things need attention”
Reviews.Author: dangrad
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here with spouse in conjunction with a friend's wedding. Large jugs with water/lemons in the lobby on a table. Cups were sometimes available. Other guests seemed to leave their used cups lying on the table for lack of someplace immediately nearby to dispose of them (just carry them outside or to the front desk). Warm cookies provided in lobby at night, but not nearly enough for all guests. One platter and when they were gone that was it. Not a good idea when the hotel was filled with kids. Check-in staff seemed a little uncomfortable with any process or request that isn't scripted. Had to ask for the package I had sent to the hotel as there was no indication in my folio it had arrived. First non-smoking room we were given reeked of cig smoke. Changed to another room at the other end of hall and no smell. Room was nice. Had fridge and microwave, desk/chair, couch and chair, end table, coffee table, but not a lot of lighting. No flat screen TV. Closet shelf was low-for hanging dress it wasn't good as it nearly hung on the floor. Lots of pillows. Neutrogena amenities. Bed was comfortable. Pool and spa area were popular with guests. Spa has sign reading "Do not use if temperature over 104F" and we didn't know if that meant outside air temperature or water temperature. At any rate, there was no way to know what the air or water temps were as there were no thermometers in the pool/spa area! Fitness center very nice with plenty of towels. Breakfast was included with my room. Selection was good. Service was spotty as FIFA World Cup games were on each morning and the waitstaff seemed far more interested in watching the game than serving customers. Several requests had to be repeated. Business center was very good. Location good for our purposes, but if you want to be within walking distance of anything this isn't a place for you. But, who walks in Dallas?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hamradioguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an outstanding stay at this hotel. The entire staff was willing to accommodate our every need while we were there. The breakfast was very yummy and very well priced for an all you can eat buffet. The bed was super comfy (can I buy one?). We will certainly be returning to this hotel in the future and recommend all of our friends to it!!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: chitowngrl84
Reviews.Content: My groups stay at the Hilton Garden Inn Market Center was Fabulous! Their staff was wonderful and exceeded all of our expectations. The service was outstanding! Next time we come to Dallas, we will definitelybe staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Austin7878
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the 4th of July hoping to have a nice, relaxing hotel experience. The hotel was empty, but the clerk put us in a room next to some teenagers who were there to party! We moved rooms 4 times in the 2 nights we were there. The second room, the people next to us were smoking in a non-smoking room and up 1/2 the night partying. The next room had an ant infestation and the next room the A/C was not working properly and the carpets and bedding were damp from humidity. This is definitely a "hit or miss" hotel, with some nice rooms and some awful rooms. The breakfast is $11.95 per person and equivalent to the free continental breakfast you get at a Quality Inn off the Interstate! We paid $75.00 a night for this experience. I guess you get what you pay for. The guests were mostly younger people there to party. If you stay one night as a business traveler, I guess you could tolerate it. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel; much cheaper than the Anatole across the street”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler31
Reviews.Content: Basic accomodations that were significantly cheaper than the Hilton Anatole; just a walk across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation apparently skipped the bedding”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night in this hotel while on a personal trip to Dallas. Certainly no quibbles re: the rate & no sign of the renovations mentioned by other reviewers, but apparently those renovations didn't include upgrading the bedding, which is a disappointment. This is also a substantially larger HGI than is normal-8 floors total vs. the 3-4 generally seen in this brand. Hotel's wireless internet in the rooms not the fastest, though the severe thunderstorms in the area the night of my stay probably didn't help or the off & on power outages. Considering how close the hotel is to the 35 freeway, I would have expected to hear freeway noise @ night, but not a peep. If I return to the area I will certainly consider this hotel again, but not if my stay extends more than 1-2 nights & that's because of the bedding situation.

Reviews.Title: “Under repair/construction... too much noise! Listen to this!”
Reviews.Author: geeimjoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel has ongoing construction throughout the south end. So much noise is not productive for those of use doing work in the room I PAID FOR. 80% of the lobby is not usable. The breakfast price is obnoxious... Denny's and other options are a quick drive. If this hotel has ongoing repair at least they should show this on their website or inform callers if a reservation is made through a phone call. Nothing indicated repair, remodeling, construction. No apology was made except for a sign asking for my acceptance for the non standard accommodations. This was my second stay with this hotel....it is most likely my last. Too much noise, entirely. This facility is not hilton quality.

Reviews.Title: “Recent flooding - Travelers beware”
Reviews.Author: SDTravel10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn - Market Center for a work trip, primarily for the location and the fact that (I thought) they wouldn't nickle and dime for everything, as more upscale places do. The hotel was absolutely packed when I arrived in the late-evening. Apparently they do a lot of corporate trainings and events here. FIrst warning sign was the closed restaurant and 8-story tarps hanging on one side of the interior walls. I was told, later, of a massive leak and flooding that occured recently. Perhaps as a result, my room was musty and a bit unpleasant upon arrival. Free internet was much appreciated, but the 10.95 charge for the breakfast buffet was not. Overall, the place had a weird vibe - I was quite happy to be moving along after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service excellent and hotel very nice”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night - got a great rate on Expedia (around $50). Checked in before 1:00 because we were going to a Dallas Stars game at 2:00 and they were able to accomodate us. First room they gave us on the third floor reeked of smoke (despite not being a smoking room), so we called to inquire abotu switching rooms and without asking they upgraded us to a deluxe room which had a larger bed and a couch, which was very nice. The room was immaculate and very comfortable. One thing they might do to improve would be flat screen LCD televisions but other than that we had a great stay. They have a great business center, always have hot coffee in the lobby (its good too), and the staff is friendly. Location is also excellent for the AA Center, and many other downtown attractions. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “They don't deliver what they promise!!”
Reviews.Author: layv2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a week ago and the hotel itself was fine, but I booked this hotel based on the shuttle service and proximity to the medical school and the airport. Before I booked the room I spoke with hotel staff to verify that the shuttle would be able available when I needed it, but unfortunately, the staff appeared to be unable to grasp the concept of setting this up- more than once. I was then also notified (the day of) that neither shuttle service was available on weekends, even though that had been a specific question prior to booking. VERY frustrating and I spent a lot of money on cab fare. I also had numerous episodes of my room key not working and needing to be reset, which the staff was never polite about and always blamed on something I must be doing to my key. I also experienced many times the hotel staff's rudeness , not just to me but other paying guests as well. The manager, Roman, was always friendly, but unfortunately couldn't offer much more than a smile. I will NOT be reusing this hotel, which disappoints me as a Hilton Honors Diamond Club member. The Hilton Anatole is directly across the street, perhaps I'll try that next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: rzer999
Reviews.Content: The property was easy to find, and the service was wonderful. We were in town for Britney Spears concert at American Airlines arena and couldn't have had a nicer stay. Roman was wonderful and very helpful in giving directions and making us feel welcome. The room was nice and spacious and my wife and I slept wonderfully in the King size bed. It was such a quick trip, but had we stayed longer, I am sure we would have been treated with the same level of service throughout. Thank-you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, many amenities, but slow service is not worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: wraithofmusic
Reviews.Content: My husband accompanied me on a business trip in March to Dallas. This was a very nice hotel to stay in for a business trip. We saved my company money by packing our food and keeping it in the fridge. They had a nice little kitchenette here, no stove or anything but a microwave, fridge, and good cabinets to keep everything in. It felt like home on the long trip. The pool and hot tub were quite nice to relax in after a long day, and the free parking sure beat the Reunion next door (within easy walking distance). Overall, our visit was quite nice, but service was extremely slow. It was hard to get a shuttle the one morning I didn't want to walk over to the Reunion in the rain. Food was very, very slow for a simple plate of pasta that came only lukewarm. The restaurant seemed unused for the most part, so they didn't really have anyone working there. I think they just pulled some people from the front desk. It's also hard to get in and out of the parking lot because of the one-way streets, very strange for a suburban area.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: heather11_13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. It was a great stay and easy to find. I felt safe and comfortable. Good sized rooms, small fridge, and comfy bed made the stay good!

Reviews.Title: “Average. Not overly impressed.”
Reviews.Author: emmaleth
Reviews.Content: The staff was not very welcoming/friendly. The small refrigerator made a racket all night long and kept me awake. Lot's of noise from the highway/planes flying close overhead. However, the rooms seemed very clean and bed was super comfortable. It's a good location to downtown without feeling like you are in a bad part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay here”
Reviews.Author: SopranosFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago and liked it, but this time it was even better. I booked through Priceline for $53/night. I checked in early since I had an early morning flight into DFW. I was there before noon but the front desk accommodated me easily. The room was great, at the end of the hall where it was nice and quiet. The beds here are fantastic! Probably one of the best I've ever slept in. They have new duvets and the sheets are nice and crisp. The mattress is extremely comfortable and the pillows were great - not too hard or too soft. I slept like a rock here. It was quiet even though there was a reunion in the hotel and it was a bit noisy due to kids but I don't think I heard anything from my room. I ate at the hotel twice - ordered room service too. The food and service were wonderful. The rooms were tastefully decorated and everything was functional. The wireless service worked the entire time I was there. It was nice to know there was security patrolling the parking lot and hotel as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - one of the best in Market Center. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with great people making us very welcome - A whole hearted recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler062
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Sunday June 21 (Father's Day) and was greeted by Amber with a great smile and welcome. I moved in to my room and my sister and her husband arrived shortly thereafter and had the room next to mine. My wife joined me later in the week. We were there until July 3 for a major trial at the Dallas County Courthouse. It was a truly grueling two weeks, but the Hilton helped make it bearable. Their shuttle got us to the courthouse safely and on time every morning and picked us up in the evening. When we entered the lobby we were always greeted with smiles and fresh cold bottled water. Every one of their staff that we had contact with was friendly and pleasant - no exceptions. This is one of the very best hotels I have visited, regardless of price. They get my unqualified vote.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: Pharmrep79
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in when in Dallas. I got a great deal from the Hilton website and this made this hotel a steal. The staff was excellent and this made this hotel really shine. I showed up late for the lunch buffet, but one of the staff members went out of his way to fetch me a plate from the back of what they still had left, a nice gesture. They were consistently good throughout the stay. The hotel is a little old, and the rooms are nothing special, but are still nice. I will stay here again, if it is under my company budget again. Oh, and the parking was fine and they have a security guard in a golf cart at night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Hotel..good food in restaurant, close to Children's med center”
Reviews.Author: Apert
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfy..beds too :-) The restaurant foos was awesome and it is less than 10 mins from Children's medical center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: parentsof5
Reviews.Content: This was an attractive hotel. Check-in was swift and effecient. We really weren't in the hotel except to sleep so I can't speak much to the ammenities. Everything looked nice and was used by other guests. The pool is outdoor so keep that in mind if it is important to have swimming during the cooler months. We did not try the restaurant, the breakfast buffet was pricey (don't know if you can order from a menu) so we utilized the fridge and had cereal in the mornings. We had 2 rooms for 2 adults and 4 teenagers.Complimentary newspaper at the door. Reserved through PL for $38 per room per night.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient”
Reviews.Author: SCHargis
Reviews.Content: Hotel has pretty lobby and efficient restaurant. Rooms are simplistic but clean. Staff was extremely friendly and very accomodating. Business center was equipped with all necessary ammenities and wireless internet in hotel was fast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Convenient Location, Some Concerns”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasMike
Reviews.Content: Hilton Garden Inn, Market Center, Dallas. After completing a five week business stay at this clean property, I am pleased to report an overall good experience. The staff was quite hospitable, and the location is central to Market Center, freeway, downtown, and Victory Center via automobile. Other than a shoe outlet, and ladies clothing store directly behind the hotel, and the beautiful Hilton Anatole across the street- there is absolutely nothing within walking distance. In fact one would be well advised to only walk during daylight hours. Avoid the area a few blocks behind the hotel. I did not experience any vehicle vandalism- but made sure to park in FRONT of the hotel. I noticed a security guard each evening who patroled the perimiter in a small jitney. Hotel offers a $ 9.95 breakfast buffet as well as dinner service only. Small lobby kiosk sells snack items. Inside atrium restaurant is well patronized by a mostly business clientele. Oversized lobby contains many couches, chairs, to allow evening socializing. I did not notice one family with children during my stay. Room is pleasantly appointed and contained a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker. Each floor landing contains couches, chairs and table- nice touch. Small business center has two computers, copy machine, printer, small conference table, and supplies. Nice sized work out room contains the usual equipment. Outdoor pool area has small jacuzzi and modest sized pool, with many chaise lounges. I always drove a few blocks to Oak Lawn Avenue for my choice of pubs and restaurants. I highly recommend Zaguan Latin Bistro & Bakery. For the tourist or family who wishes to tour Dallas- I would recommend researching a different neighborhood as home base. I had the opportunity to tour Greenville Avenue, Deep Ellum, South Lamar, Lemmon Avenue, and McKinney Avenue- which boasts a free trolley ride, and would suggest the same to anyone who has the time.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: BCSMom
Reviews.Content: Had I read the previous review before I left home, (car broken into), I probably would have cancelled my reservation. Although my car was not broken into, I could see how easily this could have happened being that the surroundings behind the hotel are a little on the seedy side. I stayed here based mainly on the good reviews here on Tripadvisor, but after I checked in, I realized it was not for me. I booked this room in Oct. or Nov. in need of a hotel close to downtown convention center. Upon arrival the front desk clerk was very cheerful and I was taken care of right away. When we got to the room, it was a king bed with a sofa bed. I reserved a room with 2 queens. I called down to the clerk and he said "oh they upgraded you because you're a Hilton Honors member - you're in a suite". I almost felt insulted - I know the difference in a "suite" and a queen - why not just tell me at check-in that you don't have my room because you overbooked? I told him I wanted the room I reserved because nobody in my family would want to sleep on a sofa bed. He said ok come on down and we'll "downgrade" you (jokingly). He gave us a queen room, but it was a handicap room which would be ok other than the shower was a walk-in, which meant a wet floor after every use. It was also a nasty shower (I took pics). The overall feel of this hotel was dirty for me. Starting in the lobby, the tile floors were dirty the whole time we were there (3 nights). The mattresses were not comfortable and the bedding only had a thin sheet and a thick comforter. What happened to putting a blanket in between? I did speak to the clerk at the desk the next day and asked if he could let me know if a Non-smoking queen room became available, but of course, it did not. I took pictures of the decaying ceiling around the vent in the shower, the nasty Hilton guest services book that had food or something smeared on the pages, and the delapidated drapes. I'll try to get those up soon. I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Car was broken into....”
Reviews.Author: radius480
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and pretty. The rooms are a bit old and have rust in the shower, I guess you should expect that in old hotels now. I always stay at Hilton since I am a Hilton Honors member and I like gaining points. I stayed here for a convention. I drove my personal car since Dallas is 4 hours from my house. This area to the naked eye looks like a nice area with the hilton anatole right next door and a nice marriott a block away. The third night into our stay at around 5 pm while I was getting ready for a dinner party, my vehicle was broken into. The drivers side window was broken and they broke my console trying to steal my CD player. Keep in mind this happened in bright day light. I went inside to tell the front desk. The on duty manager was there and he acted like he wasn't surprised. He told me that this happens frequently and it is hard to prevent it. I never recieved an apology or anything from the manager. All he said was "all I can do is call the police". I wasn't expecting a free room, but after spending 200 dollars on a new window and filing an insurance claim to fix my dash, I think I deserve more then "all I can do is call the police". I filed a police report with the Dallas police. The officer that came out, told me this area is hot right now for auto burglarys. He reccommended the next time I come to Dallas I stay in a suburb city (Plano, Duncanville, Los Colinas, Rowlett, etc). He said since all these hotels butt up next to i-35 it is easy for criminals to get away quick and far within minutes. The hotel does have security, but they dont start work until 7 pm every night. I asked the security guard since most of the cars get broken into in the afternoon why they dont have someone that works afternoons. The security guard told me the manager didnt think it was neccessary. He also told me 6 cars in the last 2 months have been broken into and seriously damaged. I will never stay at this Hilton again. I told our company travel agent as well as my friends and colleagues. Like I said, I wasn't expecting a free night or a bottle of wine. All I was asking for was a little more respect from the manager, you think that would be easy since he is in the hospitality business.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: Okay, this hotel was kinda of interesting, a check-in the front desk was excellent with setting up early check-in, schedule early morning sedan service. The staff were all very friendly, the van driver was very good and gave me a ride to/from American Airlines Arena. However, this was the bad part, my flight the next morning was delayed so i went to the front desk to let them know to call and change my pick up for the airport from 5:15 a.m to 6:30 a.m. In the middle of the night, the phone rings and it is the sedan service saying they will be there around 5AM. I was like "huh" the hotel was supposed to contact you and change it to 6:30 a.m. They were like "Well they never called and let us know", so i told them i need it at 630 and they said they weren't available then, so i said i would take care of it myself. Beware: Taxi to/from Dallas Fort Worth Airport upwards of $40.00 depending on taxi driver. The Hilton Garden Inn is next door to the Hilton Anatole.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: bbade514
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 13 nights on a business trip. Upon arrival, I was greeted by LaShawn at the front desk. She was extremely helpful and knowledgeable of the property and the surrounding area. During my stay, she would always go out of her way to find out how I was doing and even remembered my name throughout the stay. I was in an oversized room which overlooked the Market Center. The room was clean, bathroom was adequate, and there was a desk with complementary internet connection. (There is also a small business center next to the lobby) There was always plenty of room to move around even when I had everything spread out. There is a pool and spa towards the rear of the property. It was never very crowded. The hotel supplied beach towels. This property also had a restaurant on the main floor off of the lobby in the large atrium. The food was good and reasonably priced, but the service at night was very slow. It seems that they were always short handed during the evening dinner hours and could not handle the restaurant being only 1/2 full. I had the buffet breakfast in the morning which included omelets and never experienced a problem with the service. Finally this hotel also had a free shuttle service within a 5 mile radius and to Dallas Love Field. I used the service a number of occasions and the drivers were always very courteous and willing to accommodate. All in all, this is a very nice property. I would stay here next time I was in the Dallas area, but would probably skip dinner at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Hilton Garden Inn around 7:00 PM on a Tuesday night for one night's stay. My first exposure to the hotel was an exceptionally nice, helpful desk clerk (LaShanna?) who went out of her way to ask how I was doing and direct me and others to restaurants in the area. I even called the manager the next morning to provide her with positive feedback about the desk clerk (unusual for me). The hotel had a big, airy lobby, and my room was quite large - maybe more suited for two double beds than one kingsize bed. The bed and shower were fine. I didn't use it, but was pleasantly surprised to find a restaurant available for dinner in the lobby area. They also served breakfast, but I don't believe it was complimentary. I found this hotel to be fine... kind of typical of the moderately priced chains springing up all over everywhere. Not great, but OK for me. I paid the Government rate of $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: NATEB48
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, it was clean, easy to locate and the staff was great. The location was near everything in dallas. Easy access to and from the freeway, and downtown. They even have free WiFi. I would stay again. They had a pool, jacuzzi, exercise room and a resturant/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad considering the graveyard shift construction noise”
Reviews.Author: bigbaldjohnny
Reviews.Content: This place offers the average for what I expect in a hotel room. They are currently constructing a new ballroom and escavation and trash hauling noise kept me awake 2 nights. I also noticed allot of new construction on adjacent property. The room was the standard issue sort with institutional furnishings. Well used but in good repair. The bath was nice sized as well. When I spoke to the supervisor of housekeeping about the night time noise, she immediately comp'd me 2 nights making my stay a very sweet deal. They made me happy and I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Close to downtown, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: fkaway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated just next to the Hilton Anatole and other business hotels. Our room on the 7th floor was very spacious with twin beds, Iron board, no Inroom safe, free WIFI, semi-large bathroom and wardrobe. The breakfast buffet for $9.95 was good and plenty considering this hotel/Inn type. The fitness room has some running bands, crosstrainer, a weight machine but no dumbbells. Youâ€™d walk through this room to the outdoor pool. Thereâ€™s a business center incl. printer available. This hotel is ideally situated approx. 7 driving mins. from â€œThe Sixth Floor Museum (JFK museum)â€� and West End Historical District. Helpful service staff. Suitable for 1 night in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay :)”
Reviews.Author: simpaticotexas
Reviews.Content: my stay although for one night was great...the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful....the room was clean, a very nice environment for the price....would stay there again...the only negative was that it was too far from downtown...not within walking distance...but their shuttle service was available till 9 p.m....with no delays....I was very happy with what they had to offer from their hotel. crystal...central texas

Reviews.Title: “Must have a car to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea in Texas
Reviews.Content: If you are attending any events at the Dallas Trade Mart, this hotel's location cannot be beat. They have a complimentary shuttle to the Trade Mart and from Love Field so we thought a car would be unnecessary. We were wrong. There are NO nearby restaurants, so unless you enjoy overpriced hotel food for every meal, rent a car. To be fair, there is a little store in the hotel where you may purchase microwave meals to cook in your room, but that gets old very quickly. The hotel has free high speed internet, but they charge for local phone calls. The room was a typical room, smaller than some and larger than others. It was clean and the a/c was ice cold.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value and Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: marc1976
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn/Market Center from December 13, 2006 through December 15, 2006 in room 621. We were only in Dallas a couple of nights to see a hockey game and paid $69.00 a night. Overall I was pleased with the accommodations though I did encounter some minor inconveniences. The room was very clean and spacious. Both my father and I commented that the beds were probably the most comfortable we ever slept in. The room had everything we needed (desk, refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer, microwave, free USA Today, etc.). The bathroom was of average size and had plenty of towels and amenities. The television had a suitable number of channel selections. Unlike other reviewers, I did not notice any noises from the air conditioner units. Elevator service was very quick as there are only 8 floors in the hotel. The lobby area was large and had several comfortable chairs. The breakfast buffet was great. It only cost $9.95 and was open from 6-10 am. I enjoyed the free chocolate chip cookies that were served during the evening hours. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and attentive. I used the free shuttle service twice to downtown Dallas and American Airlines Center and barely had to wait at all. There are not any nearby shopping centers or restaurants within walking distance, just some major hotels, but thatâ€™s why they have the free shuttle. I did have some minor complaints. The hot tub was ice cold both days I was there. After touring Dallas all day I looked forward to relaxing in the hot tub, which was a factor in choosing this hotel. Even after the staff was informed that the hot tub water was cold, it was still cold the next day. The Pavilion Pantry was an insulting rip-off. I wanted to purchase a 12 ounce can of soda and was told that it would cost me $1.50! Even though I was thirsty and had plenty of money, I refused to purchase the can of soda out of principle. I find it odd that six 12 ounce cans of soda will cost pretty much the same as a full breakfast buffet at the HGI. I understand that hotel pantries have a larger mark-up than most retail stores, but $1.50 for a tiny can of soda was unbelievable. Even charging just 75 cents would still be a huge profit for the hotel. It was the little things like that which demonstrate some needed improvement in customer respect and reevaluation of pricing policies by management. In summation, I think I got a good deal for the price I paid and the free shuttle service was a big plus. If I return to Dallas in the future, I will stay here again. Marc T. Hardekopf

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to have your confirmation numbers kept!”
Reviews.Author: ladydne
Reviews.Content: I had reservations with this property since May for a September event. Days before arrival they call me to explain they have oversold their hotel and they are moving my reservation to a property 8 miles from the event I am attending! So don't think just because you have a reservation with them you will get a room.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but could be a lot better”
Reviews.Author: DanaZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was close to the downtown area. In fact there is not much around it, certainly nothing within walking distance. The first night we hoped to get something to eat but found the restaurant was closing at 9 though it was a Friday night. The woman at the front desk said she would ask the staff to keep it open a couple of minutes so we could order. We brought our stuff to the room and then went to the restaurant where the manager curtly told us that they were no longer serving food, that it did not matter what the woman at the front desk said, and then turned his back on us and left. The woman at the desk could provide little other information on restaurants in the area so we ended up driving around for an hour till we found something. The hotel itself was bland and looked a little soiled. Temperatures inside seemed to be in the 60's. The room was adequate but not more. There is an athletic center and business center and the tiniest outdoor pool you will probably ever see. There is plenty of parking and the highway is easy to reach. It is an ok place to stay. It is not nightmarish. But neither is it a place that is pleasant to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, so-so location”
Reviews.Author: ingleberg
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with this hotel, but am not sure I would stay here again because of the location. It only took me about 5 minutes to get to downtown, which was great, but there are NO restaurants near this hotel. Next time, I'd probably stay a little further from downtown to be closer to restaurants. Plus, were this hotel not right next to the Hilton Anatole, I might say it's not in such a great looking neighborhood (unlike a previous reviewer, I did not see any vagrants in the area). My room was large, quiet, very clean and very comfortable. The bed and shower were both great. I did have to switch rooms during my stay due to a dead air conditioner (not too surprised... Dallas in August). Very few TV channels compared to most hotels nowadays. No problems with the wired internet service. Breakfast was excellent. I ordered room service one night, and it was OK. Service overall was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sayuri72
Reviews.Content: I can say that my overall experience at this hotel was above average. The room was always very clean and the staff was very polite. The business center is free for hotel guests and open 24 hs, which was very convenient since I needed to print several documents and use the Internet for urgent matters. There is also a complimentary shuttle service every 30 minutes (although it only goes to downtown Dallas... if you need to go to the airport, you have to take a cab). The only negative aspect was that some of the staff members were not competent enough. For instance, when asking for information about the city or tours, the lady at the front desk had to check the Internet in her computer! It seems she didn't find much in there, so she suggested me to search in the pamphlet shelf by myself. Another example: one night I went to the business center and the browser was requesting a password to get connected. I called a woman at the front desk to help me; then she came to check the computer however did not know the password, or the way to get it. I asked her to call someone, but she said that it was too late to call for IT services.

Reviews.Title: “Above average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Easy180
Reviews.Content: Stayed there two nights in November and found it to be a good value factoring in free parking. The room we checked into had a bad smell coming from the restroom. We informed the front desk as we left for dinner and they had a new room ready for us when we returned. Since they quickly solved the problem we didn't think twice about it. The location isn't exactly ideal for restaurants or nightlife, but is only a couple of miles out of downtown. We highly recommend eating mexican at Pappasito's and beers at Humperdink's. Both of these places are just a few miles north of the hotel on Stemmons Freeway. Overall the hotel looked pretty new and the rooms were nice. We would consider staying here again if the price was right compared to downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was notably wary as a female business guest travelling alone. However, I felt safe at the hotel and the front desk staff was very courteous. I stayed here as part of the American Heart Association convention, so there were plenty of travellers here. Maybe that was the difference. The room was very spacious and clean. The free internet service worked without a problem. The room smelled fresh, the fridge worked great, and I didn't have a problem with the TV reception at all. The continental breakfast was good with a wide selection of food, about $8, and $2 extra for the hot items. The one reviewer was right -- there really are no close restaurants within walking distance and it is a little confusing getting on and off the highway. If I'm in Dallas again for a convention, I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad staff”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: I wound up changing hotels after expereince two major problems here. First, HGI is a very inconsistent brand with Hilton. Some are great (Houston, Mountain View, Las Colinas) others are a real mess (Montebello, Dallas/Market Center). Frtont desk here had two women who were much more interested in cracking each other up than in checking in the LINE of people waiting. One woman had such bad command of the english language that I had no idea what she was saying. Note to Hilton: Most of your business guests need someone who speaks proper English. I don't understand hip hop and don't feel I need to Schnizzel my nizzel to cjeck in to your hotel. Front desk was actibely unhelpful. Ignoring requests and generally dismissive. They were treating guests like thyey were an inconveneince to their personal conversations. Internet didn't work in the room. After 20 minutes on the line (a paid call) with tech support. no resolustion was eminent. BTW, most HGIs use Wavport which seems to work concsistenyl but this hotel does not. After telling the desk I needed a room with working Internet and would have to change hotels, they agreed to cancel the room, and then proceeded not to. Big surprise! Billing issues was finally resolved my the GM after a note to Hilton Gold Customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: julesqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel May 1-5, 2004. First I will say that this area, in general, is not very safe. While we were there we were approached twice in the parking lot by people asking for money and a truck was vandalized in the hotel parking lot. There were people begging on the street corners. I would not have gone out alone after dark but there were 3 of us so we felt a bit safer. There were no restaurants within walking distance but the hotel had a restaurant that we didn't try. For a woman traveling alone this is not the place to stay unless you are willing to eat hotel food. The room was large with a king-size bed and sofa-sleeper. The room and bathroom were very clean. The TV was not the greatest with a fuzzy screen and static in the sound. The air conditioner did not work at all but we didn't complain since it wasn't that hot during our stay. It's a bit unfair to complain about these things since we didn't tell anyone and give them a chance to fix it but it does imply that the hotel isn't real new. I was told it had opened 4 months ago but I think it must have just converted from another hotel brand. The outdoor pool was very small but there was a nice size exercise room. The greatest amenity was the *free* high-speed internet access. We had a lot of business to get done and it was fast, fast, fast -- much faster than I have at home so I was spoiled when I was there. Overall, other than the exception I made above regarding safety, I would recommend this hotel for the Market Center area.
